resources.string:
Dial Reading Help

Follow the instructions on the Dial Reading screen.

Continuous Observation Setup Help

Data Output Rate: Sets the rate at which data are archived and the screen is updated.

Filter Time Constant: Sets the time constant of a three stage RC filter in seconds.

Data Output Rate and Filter Time Constant must be chosen to satisfy the Nyquist Criterion to prevent aliasing. Choose values such that the Data Output Rate is at least twice the Filter Time Constant.

Station Details

This screen permits editing or deleting the seleted station. To edit the station data, tap on the Pencil icon in the top right corner of the screen. To delete it, tap on the Trash can icon

Station ID: Name of the station.

Observer ID: Name of the observer or any other information you wish to be included with the data.

Latitude: Decimal degrees, positive North. Leave blank or zero if unavailable.

Longitude: Decimal degrees, positive East. Leave blank or zero if unavailable.

Elevation: Elevation of the station, in meters. Leave blank or zero if unavailable.

Meter Height: Height of the gravimeter above the station, in meters. Leave blank or zero if unavailable.

Enable Earth Tide: Indicates whether Earth Tide corrections are enabled for this station. When they are enabled, they will be added to the Observed Gravity reading during Single Observations.
File Select
Stations

File Select Help

Select a file for the curent operation. If you are not in the correct directory, use the Up button to go up in the directory tree, or tap on a directory name to go down into it. When you find the file you are looking for, tap on it.

If you are creating a new file, tap on the Create New File button.

System Parameters Help

Use non-calibrated points: When this checkbox is checked, the dial value may be set to a non-calibrated point, meaning other than a multiple of 50 units. When it is unchecked, only multiples of 50 units may be used.

New Dial Reading: Permits synchronizing the gravimeter dial reading and this application. Only integer values between 250 and 6850 are accepted.

Feed Back Gain: Permits adjusting the sensitivity of the feedback. Lowering the gain increases accuracy at the expense of reading time and vice versa.

Observation Precision: Adjusts the desired precision at which a reading will be accepted. A lower precision decreases reading time and vice versa.

Enable Station Select: When this checkbox is checked, the user is able to select a station for an observation. When it is unchecked, the /"default/" station parameters are used. Leaving this selection un-checked will simplify observations by eliminating the station select screen.

Meter Connection: Displays connection type, device name and connection status.

Meter Parameters Help

Reading Line: The dial reading value at which the beam is null when the duty cycle is set to 50%.

Beam Scale: This is a scaling factor used to convert the beam position to mGal.

Feedback Scale: This is a scaling factor used to convert the feedback signal to mGal.

Minimum Stop: The dial setting at which the beam is on the bottom stop.

Maximum Stop: The dial setting at which the beam is on the top stop.

These parameters need to be verified and updated from time to time. Instructions for doing so are detailed in the manual.

Level Parameters Help

These are the parameters required to model the level correction. They may be determined and updated at any time. See the manual for details.

Stations Help

This screen permits adding a station or selecting one whose parameters will be used for the observation.

The Default station is used in all cases when the Enable Station Select checkbox in the System Parameters screen is unchecked. This station may be edited but it may not be deleted.

Stations can be exported to and imported from a CSV (comma separated value) file. The fields are ordered in the file in the same order as they appear on the screen and as shown below:

Station ID, Observer ID, Latitude, Longitude, Duty Cycle, Elevation, Height, Enable Earthtide

Survey Templates Help

This screen permits adding a survey template or selecting one whose parameters will be used to create a survey.

Survey templates can be exported to and imported from a CSV (comma separated value) file. The fields are ordered in the file in the same order as they appear on the screen and as shown below:

Survey ID, Client Name, Observer ID, Latitude, Longitude, Elevation, Height, Duty Cycle, Initial Line Number, Line Orientation, Initial Station Number, Station Orientation, Station Spacing, Station Update Direction, Enable Station Number Auto Update, Enable Reverse Station Update Direction for New Lines, Enable Earthtide

Station Edit Help

Station ID: Name of the station.

Observer ID: Name of the observer or any other information you wish to be included with the data.

Latitude: Decimal degrees, positive North. Leave Blank or zero if unavailable.

Longitude: Decimal degrees, positive East. Leave blank or zero if unavailable.

Elevation: Elevation of the station, in meters. Leave blank or zero if unavailable.

Meter Height: Height of the gravimeter above the station, in meters.

Enable Earth Tide (Checkbox): When checked the value of the Earth Tide correction (Longman) will be added to observed gravity. This applies to single observation mode only. If BOTH latitude and longitude are zero or blank no Earth Tide will be calculated. Note that both Latitude and Longitude must be zero to indicate that no coordinates are available.

Obtain Lat/Long from GPS (Button): Retrieves the latitude and longitude data from the Android device\'s internal GPS receiver.

Read Meter and Set Duty Cycle Help

This screen allows you to set the feedback force to a fixed value and displays the various outputs from the gravity sensor. This is useful for certain calibration procedures. You will see the effect of a new duty cycle value only after you have started a reading. You can send new duty cycle values to the meter as needed.

New Duty Cycle: Enter a new duty cycle value, between 5 and 98, then tap the Set button.

Set: Sends the New Duty Cycle value to the meter.

Start Reading: This button tells the meter to start sending gravity data in one second intervals. This data is displayed in the fields at the top of the screen. The reading will be terminated when you leave this tab.

Set Stops and Reading Line Help

This screen allows you to determine the meter\'s maximum and minimum stops and reading line. Refer to Chapter Five, Adjusting Beam Stops in the manual.

10\%%: Sets the meter\'s duty cycle to 10\%%.

50\%%: Sets the meter\'s duty cycle to 50\%%.

90\%%: Sets the meter\'s duty cycle to 90\%%.

New Duty Cycle: Enter a new duty cycle value, between 5 and 98, then tap the Set button.

Set: Sends the New Duty Cycle value to the meter.

Start Reading: This button tells the meter to start sending gravity data in one second intervals, which will be displayed in the Beam Frequency field. The reading will be terminated when you leave this tab.

Accept: Stores the Maximum and Minimum Stops and Reading Line values in the application database. They can be viewed in the Meter Parameters screen.

Calculate Beam Scale Help

This screen allows you to determine the meter\'s beam scale value. See Chapter Five, Calculate Beam Scale Factor in the manual.

50\%%: Sets the meter\'s duty cycle to 50\%%.

Base Dial Reading: .

Base DR -0.250 mGal: .

Base DR +0.250 mGal: .

-0.250 Beam Freq: .

+0.250 Beam Freq: .

Delta Freq: .

Beam Scale: The calculated beam scale value.

Start Reading: This button tells the meter to start sending gravity data in one second intervals, which will be displayed in the Beam Frequency field. The reading will be terminated when you leave this tab.

Accept: Stores the Beam Scale value in the application database. It can be viewed in the Meter Parameters screen.

Output Observation Data Help

This screen allows you to manage the observation data. Data may be saved on the Android device\'s internal SD card for uploading to a computer using the Save buttons, or deleted from the application\'s internal database with the Delete buttons.

The data is sent in CSV (comma separated values) format. This format is suitable for direct input into spread sheets and other programs. The data is not automatically deleted after an upload; you must use the delete buttons to delete unwanted data. New data is always appended to the end of existing data. The number of records stored in the application\'s internal database is displayed at the top of the screen.

Single Mode Data File: Single Mode observation data records consist of 20 fields. They are saved in the following order: Station ID, ObserverID, Meter Serial Number, Date, Time, Observed gravity, Dial Reading, Feedback Correction, Earth Tide Correction, Level Correction, Temperature Correction, Beam Error, Meter Height, Elevation, Latitude, Longitude, Elapsed Time, Standard Deviation, Temperature Frequency, Note.

Continuous Mode Data File: Continuous Mode observation data can be saved as either short or long records. Short records consist of 9 fields. They are saved in the following order: Date, Time, Observed Gravity, Dial Reading, Feedback Correction, Earth Tide Value, Level Correction, Temperature Correction and Note.

Long records consist of 23 fields. They are saved in the following order: Date, Time, Observed Gravity, Dial, Feedback Correction, Earth Tide Correction, Level Correction, Temperature Correction, Station ID, Observer ID, Meter Serial Number, Height, Elevation, Latitude, Longitude, Elapsed Time, Data Output Rate, Filter Time Constant, Temperature Frequency, Beam Frequency, Cross Level Frequency, Long Level Frequency, Note.

The units for the data are shown in the table below.

Field Units
Gravity mGals
Elevation meters
Height meters
Latitude degrees (decimal) positive North
Longitude degrees (decimal) positive East
Date yyyy/mm/ss
Time hh:mm:ss

View Observation Data Help

This screen allows you to view the observation data stored in the application\'s internal SD card. Tap one of the three buttons to view the data. The screen scolls both horizonally and vertically to allow viewing of all the data. Large data files may take some time to load. The Output Observations tab displays the number of Single and Continuous Mode records stored in the device.

View Single Mode Data File: Displays the single mode observation data.

View Short Continuous Mode Data File: Displays the short records of continuous mode observation data.

View Long Continuous Mode Data File: Displays the long records of continuous mode observation data.

Earth Tide Help

The Earth Tide screen allows you to calculate and display earth tide data for a given day, in 10 minute increments. The current date, latitude and longitude are automatically filled in. You can enter a different date, latitude or longitude if you so choose.

Year: Enter the 4 digit year, such as 2014.

Month: Enter a number from 1 - 12.

Day: Enter a number from 1 - 31 (depending on the month and year).

Latitude: Enter the latitude value, in decimal, with north being positive.

Longitude: Enter the longitude value, in decimal, with east being positive.

Elevation: Enter the location\'s elevation, in meters.

Calculate: Calculates and displays the earth tide data.

Obtain Lat/Long from GPS: Retrieves latitude and longitude values from the Android device\'s internal GPS.

Save Data: Not currently implemented.

Private Parameters Help

Calibrated: Check this box if the meter is calibrated.

Plates Reversed: Check this box if the plates are reversed.

Save Frequencies: Check this box if you want the beam, levels and temperature frequencies saved with the other observation data in the Output Observation screen.

Test Mode: Check this box to display the following fields during single and continuous mode observations: Beam Frequency, Cross Level Frequency, Long Level Frequency, Temperature Frequency, Temp 0 and Temp B Factor.

Load Calibration Table: Loads a calibration table.

Create Factory Params File: Creates a factory parameters file. This file can be used to restore from if a customer makes changes to one or more factory parameters and later wants to return to the factory parameters. This file is not visible to anyone; it can only be created and restored from. The file stores the following parameters: Feedback Gain, Observation Precision, Data Output Rate, Filter Time Constant, Reading Line, Beam Scale, Feedback Scale, Minimum Stop, Maximum Stop, Long Level0, Long LevelA, Long LevelB, Long LevelC, Cross Level0, Cross LevelA, Cross LevelB, Cross LevelC.

Cancel: Exits this screen without saving any changes.

Calculate Beam Scale Help

This screen allows you to determine and save the meter\'s beam scale value.

50\%%: Sets the meter\'s duty cycle to 50\%%.

Base Dial Reading: .

Base DR -0.500 mGal: .

Base DR +0.500 mGal: .

-0.500 Beam Freq: .

+0.500 Beam Freq: .

Delta Freq: .

Beam Scale: The calculated beam scale value.

Start Reading: This button tells the meter to start sending gravity data in one second intervals, which will be displayed in the Beam Frequency field. The reading will be terminated when you leave this tab.

Accept: Stores the Beam Scale value in the application database. It can be viewed in the Meter Parameters screen.

Calculate Feedback Scale Help

This screen allows you to determine and save the meter\'s feedback scale.

10\%%: Sets the meter\'s duty cycle to 10\%%.

50\%%: Sets the meter\'s duty cycle to 50\%%.

90\%%: Sets the meter\'s duty cycle to 90\%%.

Current Duty Cycle: The duty cycle value most recently sent to the meter.

New Duty Cycle: Enter a new duty cycle value, between 5 and 98, then tap the Set button.

Set: Sends the New Duty Cycle value to the meter.

Freq row: Enter ?? values in these fields.

5\%% row: Enter ?? values in these fields.

98\%% row: Enter ?? values in these fields.

Delta value row: These values are the 5\%% value - the 98\%% value from the same column.

C/.93: The 0 position Delta value divided by .93.

FDK Scale: The FDK Scale calculated from the above values.

CCNM Factor: The factor calculated from field tests.

Final FDK Scale: The FDK Scale with the CCNM Factor applied to it.

Start Reading: Tap this button to tell the meter to start sending gravity data in one second intervals. The only data from the meter which will be displayed is the Beam Frequency field. The reading will be terminated when you leave this tab.

Clear All: Tap this button to clear all the fields on this screen.

Accept: Tap this button to store the Feedback Scale and all the other fields in the application database. The Feedback Scale can be viewed in the Meter Parameters screen. All the other fields will be recalled the next time this screen is displayed.
Latitude\nN(+)/S(-)
There is an error with this device\'s adapter.
You are about to delete the station %1$s.
The device internal memory is %1$.1f%% full. Data loss may result.
Must be an integer between %1$d and %2$d and a multiple of %3$d

Before taking the next reading,
• Clamp the beam,
• Occupy your next station,
• Level the meter,
• Unclamp the beam,
• Press Continue when ready.
Latitud\nN(+)/S(-)
Hay un error con el adaptador Bluetooth de este dispositivo.
